definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen

sentences.english: As a safeguard, officers-in-charge of departments are requested to verify identification by comparing signatures.
sentences.chinese: 爲安全起見，部門負責主管應比對簽字檢驗身份。

sentences.english: It was signed with a different mark.
sentences.chinese: 它是用一個不同的標記簽字的。

sentences.english: The agreement shall enter into force upon signature.
Dong Yun Zhou Siwei wife has filed for divorce at this time, he refused to sign it.
sentences.chinese: 周斯偉的妻子董芸卻在此時提出離婚，他拒絕簽字。

sentences.english: After the talks, Hu and Koehler witnessed the signing of cooperative deals between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 會談後，兩國領導人出席了雙邊合作文件的簽字儀式。

sentences.english: Okay, I'll check the signature of the guest in room 3307.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我將覈查一下3307房間客人的簽字。

sentences.english: The "Sino-American high tech projects co-operation signing ceremony" was held in Shanghai today.
sentences.chinese: “中美合作高科技項目簽字儀式”今天在上海舉行。

sentences.english: Where the Declaration of Independence was signed?
Each Signature phone contains 388 mechanical parts.
sentences.chinese: 每一簽字電話包含388機械零件。

sentences.english: which the signature will be inspected by issuing bank.
sentences.chinese: 哪一個簽字將會被開狀銀行檢查。

sentences.english: The straight line signature of cosmic ray muons disappears underground.
sentences.chinese: 直線簽字宇宙射線μ介子消失地下。

sentences.english: Mr Li asks Mr Yang to draft the contract, which will be signed by the two parties the following morning.
sentences.chinese: 李先生讓楊先生起草合同，雙方將在第二天早晨簽字。

sentences.english: He signed and sealed the document.
When do you think it convenient to hand in the Mate's Receipts for your signature?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲什麼時候交來大副收據讓你簽字合適？

sentences.english: This regulation will be enacted after signature by the person with authorities of both parties.
sentences.chinese: 第十五條本規程由雙方協商一致，負責人簽字後生效。

sentences.english: The CVP Signatory must take an active part in the application process.
sentences.chinese: 公司簽證項目簽字人必須積極參加申請流程。

definition: to consult with/to talk things over/agreement
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
to have the right to/to be entitled to/to have authority/powerful
to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
